item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 3 Wisconsin women's volleyball team dominated in the First Round of the NCAA Tournament, sweeping Eastern Illinois (25-11, 25-6, 25-19) behind another strong performance on the offensive end.

item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team renews one of college basketball's most storied rivalries, facing Marquette for the 132nd on Saturday. Tipoff at the Kohl Center is set for 1 p.m. CT.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 3 Badgers begin playoff journey
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 3 Wisconsin volleyball team begins their quest to Kansas City and an NCAA Championship this week, as they will take on Eastern Illinois on Thursday, Dec. 4 at the UW Field House in the First Round of the NCAA Tournament.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Volleyball All-B1G Honors Announced
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – Carter Booth, Mimi Colyer and Charlie Fuerbringer of the Wisconsin volleyball team have been named to the 2025 All-Big Ten First Team, while freshman Kristen Simon earned All-Freshman honors, announced by the conference Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Colyer tallies fifth weekly conference award
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - For the fifth time this season, outside hitter Mimi Colyer of the Wisconsin volleyball team has been awarded the Big Ten Player of the Week after another pair of strong performances to close out the regular season.

UW News • Volleyball: Tourney Time: Badgers earn three seed in NCAA Tournament
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - For the 13th-straight season and 29th time in program history, the Wisconsin women's volleyball team earned a berth to the NCAA Tournament. The Badgers were selected as the No. 3 seed in the Texas Regional, and will host the First and Second round matches on Thursday, Dec. 4 and Friday, Dec. 5.

item.title: UW News • Football: Wisconsin falls at Minnesota in season finale
item.description: The Wisconsin Badgers (4-8) fell to the Minnesota Golden Gophers (7-5) by a 17-7 score Saturday evening to wrap up the 2025 season.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 10 Badgers complete regular season in emphatic fashion
item.description: MINNEAPOLIS, Minn. - The No. 10 Wisconsin volleyball team dominated in their final showing of the regular season, sweeping No. 18 Minnesota (25-18, 25-18, 25-17) to secure their ninth-straight victory.

item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team fell to TCU 74-63 in the Rady Children's Invitational Championship Game on Friday at the Jenny Craig Pavilion.

item.description: Wisconsin men's basketball guard Nick Boyd posted a career-high 36 points in a 104-83 win over Providence on Thursday at the Rady Children's Invitational at the Jenny Craig Pavilion.

UW News • Volleyball: No. 10 Badgers tally eighth-straight victory
item.description: EVANSTON, Ill. - The No. 10 Wisconsin volleyball team notched its eighth victory in a row by defeating Northwestern on the road in four sets (25-18, 25-22, 20-25, 25-22) to kick off the final week of the regular season.

UW News • Men's Basketball: Wisconsin men's basketball packages food in San Diego
item.description: As part of their west coast trip to San Diego, The Wisconsin men's basketball team took part in a community service project to help those in need during Thanksgiving Tuesday by sorting produce and organizing food boxes to hand out in the community.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: No. 10 Badgers enter final week of regular season
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The No. 10 Wisconsin women's volleyball team is back on the road for the final week of the regular season, as they prepare to take on Northwestern on Wednesday, Nov. 26 and No. 18 Minnesota on Friday, Nov. 28.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Fuerbringer Tabbed B1G Setter of the Week
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – For the fourth time this season, and in back-to-back weeks, Wisconsin volleyball's Charlie Fuerbringer has been named Big Ten Setter of the Week.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Drafted: Badger Duo Head to Dallas
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – Mimi Colyer and Carter Booth of the Wisconsin volleyball team were drafted by the Dallas Pulse of the inaugural season of Major League Volleyball, announced Monday. Colyer was drafted No. 1 overall, while Booth was drafted as the 19th overall pick.

item.title: UW News • Football: Wisconsin takes down No. 21 Illinois on senior day
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The Wisconsin Badgers scored another ranked win at Camp Randall, taking down No. 21 Illinois on Senior Night, 27-10. Wisconsin was led by 131 rushing yards from Darrion Dupree and a stout defensive effort, holding off the Fighting Illini to secure a pair of wins over ranked opponents for the first time in a single season since 2019.
